title: 19th Century Typography - Clipper Cards
content:
For your viewing pleasure... found this link through [Drawn! The Illustration and Cartooning Blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20080917021956/http:/www.drawn.ca/). This is an amazing collection of what are known as [Clipper Cards](http://web.archive.org/web/20080917021956/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/pantufla/sets/72157594489508934/), from the 1850’s and 60’s. Great vintage illustration and typography. Enjoy!

 [‹ Web Typography Sucks](http://web.archive.org/web/20080917021956/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32211 "Go to previous forum topic") [Better typography in MS Word--is it possible? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080917021956/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32239 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Chris Keegan
